{"ops":[{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"font":"arial"},"insert":"This runbook checks if there are any MPLS misconfigurations."},{"insert":"

"},{"attributes":{"font":"arial"},"insert":"1. Checking the MPLS LDP detail and labeling the prefix number, any change by the monitor alert view."},{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"font":"arial"},"insert":"2. Checking all MPLS configuration and including MPLS interface states of equipment configurations; Checking whether there is a configuration error."},{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"font":"arial"},"insert":"3. Collect auxiliary MPLS lines of incorrect show commands."},{"insert":"

"},{"attributes":{"font":"arial"},"insert":"References:"},{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"link":"http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios/12_4t/12_4t2/ftldp41.html"},"insert":"Troubleshooting MPLS Label Distribution Protocol Problem"},{"insert":"
"}]}
rb_notes.text:
This runbook checks if there are any MPLS misconfigurations.

1. Checking the MPLS LDP detail and labeling the prefix number, any change by the monitor alert view.
2. Checking all MPLS configuration and including MPLS interface states of equipment configurations; Checking whether there is a configuration error.
3. Collect auxiliary MPLS lines of incorrect show commands.

References:
Troubleshooting MPLS Label Distribution Protocol Problem

"},{"attributes":{"font":"arial"},"insert":"1. Checking the MPLS LDP detail and labeling the prefix number, any change by the monitor alert view."},{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"font":"arial"},"insert":"2. Checking all MPLS configuration and including MPLS interface states of equipment configurations; Checking whether there is a configuration error."},{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"font":"arial"},"insert":"3. Collect auxiliary MPLS lines of incorrect show commands."},{"insert":"

"},{"attributes":{"font":"arial"},"insert":"References:"},{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"link":"http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios/12_4t/12_4t2/ftldp41.html"},"insert":"Troubleshooting MPLS Label Distribution Protocol Problem"},{"insert":"
"}]}
rb_notes.text:
This runbook checks if there are any MPLS misconfigurations.

1. Checking the MPLS LDP detail and labeling the prefix number, any change by the monitor alert view.
2. Checking all MPLS configuration and including MPLS interface states of equipment configurations; Checking whether there is a configuration error.
3. Collect auxiliary MPLS lines of incorrect show commands.

References:
Troubleshooting MPLS Label Distribution Protocol Problem
